  About The Royal
  
 As one of Canada’s foremost mental health care and academic health science centres, The Royal has a clear purpose: to get more people living with mental illness into recovery faster. This is at the core of everything we do and it is driven by the passion, focus and dedication of our employees. Every day, the work that we do transforms the lives of people with mental illness through specialized mental healthcare, advocacy, research and education. 
 
 This position provides professional administrative support and office management to the Associate Chief, the Vice President Patient Care Services & Chief Nursing Executive, and the Vice President Patient Care Services & Community Mental Health; to ensure efficient and effective administration of the department/program.
  Duties:
  Accountability #1: Administrative support/Office management
 
   Responsible for organization & scheduling of meetings, including collection of agenda items, follow up on action items, preparation and distribution of agenda packages, recording, production and distribution of minutes
   Manages calendars and assists with time management
   Drafts and types correspondence, receives/sends mail, including email
   Responds to queries from the general public, hospital departments, external organizations 
  Screens and actions incoming mail, emails and telephone calls using own judgment and knowledge
   Makes travel arrangements & completes expense reports as required
   Ensures all deadlines are met, including project tracking, information gathering, report production, etc.
   Schedules staff meetings
   Provides office and automated systems orientation and training for new staff members
   Prepares invoices/requisitions as required for ordering office supplies, materials, repairs, etc.
   Prepares Personnel Action Forms of reporting staff and other documents, as required
   Provides daily schedule including preparation of background information for the days’ meetings
   Maintains bring forward system and organizes/maintains an effective filing system
   Maintains OREO pages for department/program
   Coordinates site visits
   Arranges interviews and prepares information for potential and new physicians, composes offer letters and gathers appropriate information for credentialing
   Ensures sessionals/stipends are paid accurately
   Requests cheques for physicians not paid through Medco Services
   Prepares & drafts PowerPoint presentations and other presentations as required
   Schedules on-call services physicians
   Liaises with senior management teams, directors and their administrative assistants
   Liaises with pharmaceutical representatives to plan and schedule continuing mental health education sessions; plan, advertise, evaluate feedback, follow up for conferences
 
  Accountability #2: Budgeting responsibilities
 
   Assists with annual budget preparation
   Assists with budget planning; monitors and tracks budget expenses – operating and salary
   Audits payroll, sick leave, vacation and labour distribution reports and reports variances
 
  Accountability #3: Data Management
 
   Organizes/maintains major legal, financial and administrative documents
   Assists in gathering, compilation and dissemination of data and statistics
   Maintains the corporate files of the program/department
   Maintains accurate leave records for staff
   Ensures confidentiality of sensitive information – patient correspondence, public enquires, patient/family complaints
   Processes bi-weekly pay cards and maintains appropriate supporting documentation
   Maintains a copy of all policies and procedures and updates as new polices/procedures become available
   Facilitates completion of annual performance appraisals of reporting staff
   Processes and maintains billing for the Associate Chief and Physicians
 
  Accountability #4: Other Duties
 
   Assists with projects as needed
   Works in a manner that is in compliance with staff and patient/client safety practices, policies and procedures of The Royal.
   Ensures a work environment that is conducive to The Royal’s Harassment-Free Workplace and Occupational Health and Safety policies.
   Undertakes special assignments/projects and other duties as assigned.
 
  Qualifications:
 
   Post-secondary level education, preferably a two (2) year community college diploma in Office Administration or equivalent experience
   Minimum of five years recent, related secretarial/administrative experience supporting senior level management
   Typing speed – minimum of 60 words per minute with high accuracy.
   Demonstrated experience in windows-based applications including a high level of competency with Outlook, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel). 
  Planning, prioritization and organization skills to ensure that tasks are completed; work well under pressure
   Power B1 system knowledge would be an asset
   Demonstrate interpersonal skills and proficiency in business vocabulary
   Time management skills to plan, manage and coordinate activities
   Attention to detail and decision-making skills to respond to high-pressure situations
   Demonstrate ability to handle confidential/sensitive information
   Prepare clear, concise and accurate documentation
   Establish and maintain effective working relationships
   Ability to work independently in the completion of assigned tasks
   Ability to meet deadlines, established objectives with multiple interruptions
   Excellent communication skills – verbal and written
   Strong problem-solving and analytical skills and the ability to handle multiple responsibilities effectively
   Ability to coordinate and manage small administrative projects
   English level A- is mandatory in oral expression, comprehension, reading & writing. Bilingual (French/English) is considered an asset
  
 
  
 
  Additional Information
  
 
  All applicants must provide a recent resume that clearly indicate that they meet the required qualifications. 
  The Royal sincerely thanks all applicants for their interest in a career with us; however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. 
  All new hires will be required to obtain a clear and valid Criminal Record or Vulnerable Sector Records Check as a pre-condition of employment. 
  The Royal is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the recruitment process.
